result.execSummary:
The defendant Carlton Allen Brown was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 1st-Degree Recklessly Endangering Safety, a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.30(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

superMiscConds.notes: Provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank; pay surcharge. Pay all applicable court costs and surcharges including the DNA surcharge by 05-11-15 or, if not paid, a civil judgment is ordered.

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor. Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

NO CONTACT ORDER REMAINS

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Carlton Allen Brown

records.addlTxt: Signed and filed - Order on Petition for Civil Judgment for Court Ordered Financial Obligations.  Forwarded to DOC for further processing.

records.addlTxt: Per Order of the Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this motion/request is hereby assigned to the Hon. Frederick C. Rosa, Br. 35, for review. jbs
Letter to defendant indicating that DNA surcharge is mandatory as of January 1, 2014.
Letter from defendant asking court to vacate DNA surcharge.
Filed, signed Decision and Order Denying Motion to Exclude Gifted Funds From DOC Deductions.
Per order of Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this request/motion is hereby assigned to the Hon. Thomas J. McAdams, Br. 7, for review. crt
Defendant's pro se request to exclude gift moneys from DOC deductions.
Letter to defendant regarding payment of financial obligations during period of confinement.
Letter from defendant regarding payment of financial obligations during period of confinement.

Defendant Carlton Allen Brown in court with attorney Thomas J. Kasen.  Defendant Carlton Allen Brown in custody.  Randy P. Sitzberger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 6 YEARS, with credit for 264 days time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 3 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 3 YEARS.  The defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and is eligible for the "Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program".
Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs 5.11.15 or a civil judgment is ordered.
Court ordered defendant to pay all applicable court costs and surcharges by 5.11.15 or, if not paid, a civil judgment is ordered.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor. Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored. 
NO CONTACT ORDER REMAINS.
Filed,
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence;
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief.
March 10, 2015 @ 1:30P in BR 7, CH Rm 629 of the Circuit Court of Milwaukee County.

Defendant Carlton Allen Brown in court with attorney Thomas J. Kasen.  Defendant Carlton Allen Brown in custody.  Nathaniel E Adamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
On State's motion, Court ordered PENALTY ENHANCER USE OF A DANGEROUS WEAPON  DISMISSED.
Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Defendant is advised he is a convicted felon and may not possess any firearms. Defendant is advised he is unable to vote in any election until civil rights are restored. Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for 03-10-2015 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Thomas J. Kasen in court, defendant Carlton Allen Brown not in court, in custody.  Randy P. Sitzberger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Court ordered case adjourned for final pre-trial conference in Branch 7.  Final pre-trial scheduled for 02-27-2015 at 08:30 am.
received and filed from the defendant.
subpoena
Final pre-trial on February 24, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Parties are being notified that effective December 1, 2014 this case will be assigned to Judge Thomas McAdams, Branch 7, in Room 629 of the Courthouse.

Defendant Carlton Allen Brown in court with attorney Thomas J. Kasen.  Defendant Carlton Allen Brown in custody.  Randy P. Sitzberger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case is scheduled for Jury Trial. For the reasons placed on the record the State requests an adjournment. Defense does not object to an adjournment. Court orders case adjourned for Final Pretrial on 2-24-2015 at 8:30 a.m. and Jury Trial on 3-9-2015 at 9:00 a.m., Br. 17.
Final pre-trial scheduled for February 24, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for March 9, 2015 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Carlton Allen Brown in court with attorney Thomas J. Kasen.  Defendant Carlton Allen Brown in custody.  Randy P. Sitzberger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Notice of Alibi filed by Attorney Thomas Kasen, received.
Final Pretrial proceeds. Case remains calendared for Jury Trial on 11-3-2014 at 9:00 a.m., Br.17.

Attorney Thomas J. Kasen in court, defendant Carlton Allen Brown not in court, in custody.  Paul M. Hauer on behalf of Randy Sitzberger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy court clerk ccp.
Case set for final pretrial. ADA Sitzberger appeared for the State of Wisconsin during the hearing. Defense counsel requests an adjourned final pretrial date. Court grants request. State turned over additional discovery to defense counsel today. Discussion regarding defendant's letter to the Court requesting a new attorney. Attorney Kasen spoke to the defendant and will remain as counsel of record. Case remains scheduled for jury trial on 11/03/14. Case adjourned to Branch 17.  Final pre-trial scheduled for October 31, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
State's Motion in Limine recieved and filed. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.
State's Requested Jury Instructions recieved and filed. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.
State's Witness List recieved and filed. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.

Attorney Thomas J. Kasen in court, defendant Carlton Allen Brown not in court, in custody.  Hanna R. Kolberg for Randy Sitzberger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Matter before court for motion to withdraw as counsel.  Attorney Kasen informs the court that defendant wishes to proceed with him as attorney.  Court orders case adjourned to Branch 17. Case remains scheduled for Final pretrial on 10-21-2014 at 8:30 am and Jury trial on 11-03-2014 at 9:00 am.
Pro-se motion received and filed.

Attorney Thomas J. Kasen in court, defendant Carlton Allen Brown not in court, in custody.  Danielle E. Chojnacki for Randy Sitzberger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defense requests date be set for Final Pretrial and Jury Trial.   Defense counsel has received discovery and offer.  Felony Pretrial Scheduling Order signed and filed.  Copies given to state and defense counsel.  Case is adjourned for Final Pretrial Conference on 10/21/2014 at 8:30 a.m. and Jury Trial on 11/3/2014 at 9:00 a.m., Br. 17.  Final pre-trial scheduled for October 21, 2014 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for November 3, 2014 at 09:00 am.

Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  Court consented to substitution against Judge Siefert.  Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Judge Stark, Br. 17. Case calendared for SCHEDULING on 8/19/2014 at 1:30 pm.

Attorney Thomas J. Kasen in court, defendant Carlton Allen Brown not in court, in custody. William Levins for  Randy P. Sitzberger appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
Court waives defendants appearance for todays proceedngs.   Parties advised effective August 2, 2014, this case will be reassigned to Judge Siefert, Branch 47, Room 629 of the Courthouse.

Defendant Carlton Allen Brown not in court, defendant in custody.  Randy P. Sitzberger appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
Attorney Kasen did not check in with the court. Case calendared for STATUS on 7/28/2014 at 8:30 am in Branch 15.

Defendant Carlton Allen Brown in court with attorney Thomas J Kasen.  Defendant Carlton Allen Brown in custody.  Nathaniel Adamson for Randy P Sitzberger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state:Juanita Carr-MPD Detective.  Exhibit #1 is marked, offered and received into evidence.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court. Court enters a not guilty plea on behalf of the defendant.  Exhibit is ordered withdrawn.  Scheduling conference scheduled for July 18, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with TODD K., LOVEST B., BRIANNA S. AND AUTO SHOP, 3001 W LISBON AVE.
  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Carlton Allen Brown in court with attorney Alexis R Liggins.  Defendant Carlton Allen Brown in custody.  Carole R Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge WATTS, Branch 15.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 1, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
Arrest Warrant received from the D.A.'s office on filing date of Criminal Complaint.
